comments.body: @jreback I had to modify this test to hit the block [here](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/16301/files#diff-1b15d1477da3a0548d2dd72a5d023d00R321). I'm pretty sure you were just using `store` as an example of a buffer that isn't an HDFStore or filepath. But with these changes it'll be coerced to a path.
can you add the issue number as a comment
can you add the issue number

    def test_start_stop_multiple(self):

        # GH 16209
        with ensure_clean_store(self.path) as store:

comments.body: this doesn't make sense. you are specifying a complib, yet no compression? again this is confusing.

I added the 3 cases where at least one of the parameters complib and complevel is missing. Setting complib and leaving complevel unset is one of those. I think these are good tests to see if the defaults behave as we discussed. 

I did not add tests to see what would happen if i set the parameters to illegal values, fx what happens if complevel is negative? 

I also added the testcase where i override the file-wide defaults.
add some tests for illegal values, though PyTables should actually validate these

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +754,758 @@
        # Set complib and check to see if compression is disabled
        with ensure_clean_path(self.path) as tmpfile:
            df.to_hdf(tmpfile, 'df', complib='zlib')
            result = pd.read_hdf(tmpfile, 'df')
